qas.question: How many times did FBI agents first their weapons from 1993 to 2011?
How many times were FBI shots not justified?
How many people were wounded in the cases where FBI shooting was not justified?
How did Samuel Walker describe the number of unjustified shots fired?
On what was the shooting of an innocent Maryland man deemed justified?
How often did FBI agents fire their weapons before 1993?
What professor said the number of shots found to be unjustified was suspiciously high?
How many people did the FBI wound before 1993?
During what period did the FBI find all shooting by FBI agents to be unjustified?
How much did the CIA pay out to an innocent man that was shot?

context: During the period from 1993 to 2011, FBI agents fired their weapons on <a0_0><b5_0>289<b5_0/><a0_0/> occasions; FBI internal reviews found the shots justified in all but <a1_0>5 cases<a1_0/>, in <a2_0>none<a2_0/> of the 5 cases were people wounded. <b6_0>Samuel Walker<b6_0/>, a professor of criminal justice at the University of Nebraska Omaha said the number of shots found to be unjustified was "<a3_0>suspiciously low<a3_0/>." In the same time period, the FBI wounded <b7_0>150<b7_0/> people, 70 of whom died; the FBI found all 150 shootings to be justified. Likewise, during the period from <b8_0>2011 to the present<b8_0/>, all shootings by FBI agents have been found to be justified by internal investigation. In a 2002 case in Maryland, an innocent man was shot, and later paid $<b9_0>1.3 million<b9_0/> by the FBI after agents mistook him for a bank robber; the internal investigation found that the shooting was justified, based on <a4_0>the man's actions<a4_0/>.
